result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond J Lorenzo-Correro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive each other, and any other sentence, with full Huber privileges.

miscConds.notes:
COUNTS 2 & 3:  Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

No contact with victim, unless approved by court or agent.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Batterers Intervention program.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

records.addlTxt:
Per an e-mail received from the agent, the defendant has been revoked.  Review hearing vacated.
cab

Defendant Raymond J Lorenzo-Correro in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Court reviewed and returned photograph CD to the state. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 80 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive each other, and any other sentence, with full Huber privileges.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 80 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive each other, and any other sentence, with full Huber privileges.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 25 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim, unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond J Lorenzo-Correro in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #2 and COUNT #3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 23 on 6-25-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Zorines V., or her residence, no guns in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Raymond J Lorenzo-Correro in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Br. 4 for Br. 23.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #2 to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s): 947.01(1) and 973.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor."   mld
Case spun to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.

Defendant Raymond J Lorenzo-Correro in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JUDGE KONKOL FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea Hearing. Case adjourned for Plea Hearing to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond J Lorenzo-Correro in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Owen Piotrowski for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Eulia Kazachenko.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Zorines V. or her residence

Defendant Raymond J Lorenzo-Correro in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Raymond J Lorenzo-Correro in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
